title: Amherst County at Liberty
text:
Amherst at Liberty BEDFORD, Va. - 
The Liberty Minutemen are fresh-off a Saturday night win over Hidden Valley, looking to build on that against a tough Amherst team. 
This also a Thursday night match-up, where Liberty was trying to get above .500 against the Lancers, who've won two straight. 
This one was back and forth early, but Amherst went on a scoring-spree in the second and third quarters. Jerry Page, who rushed for 174 yards on 20 carries, went in for the Lancer touchdown. 
But Liberty was not going away. Tyron Staples fielded the kick-off, picking it up off the bounce, and returned it 90 yards, trucking down the middle of the field for the touchdown. He also had more than 100 yards rushing in the game for the Minutemen. But even that effort was not enough, as Amherst poured it on after that. Trae Shuford got through traffic and sprinted in for the touchdown, adding to the Lancers' lead. 
Then Jason Whitley got in on the scoring. Six different Amherst players had a touchdown in the game, as the Lancers roll to the 70-38 win over Liberty.
